page.title: 12INDUSTRY.
page.content: There is no heavy industry in the area of Harlestone,Church Brampton and Althorp.The thriving quarries and brick kilns of the past are now closed. The saw mill in the Harlestone Firs sells timber for "rustic poles", garden furniture and firewood.It is open five days a week.The "Firs" are on Spencer land.Replanting of felled timber is carried out. There is an oil depot in Harlestone supplying local farmers.Farmers without storage facilities can rent storage tanks from a firm next to the depot. Burrows steel yard at Althorp station (demolished)produce prefabricated industrial and agricultural buildings. The corn mill at Harlestone is derelict. A solid fuel merchant and garden pool firm are based at the garden centre.
